citation.article-title: Alteromonas stellipolaris sp. nov., a novel, budding, prosthecate bacterium from Antarctic seas, and emended description of the genus Alteromonas.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Alteromonas Baumann et al. 1972 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Gauthier et al. 1995
The description is as given by Gauthier et al. (1995) with the following additional morphological features.

When grown on marine or PYG agar at low temperatures (12–20 °C) for 3 or more days, cells of A. macleodii LMG 2843T, A. marina LMG 22057T and A. stellipolaris LMG 21861T, LMG 21856, LMG 21859, LMG 21860 and LMG 21863 produce buds and prosthecae (see Figs 2, 3 and 4).
Cells of A. macleodii and A. marina form only short, straight prosthecae; branching is not observed (Fig. 4).
Electron micrographs of negatively stained preparations of cells of (a) Alteromonas macleodii and (b) Alteromonas marina, showing prosthecae (P) and buds (B).
Colonies used for analysis were grown on marine agar at 20 °C for 12 days or on PYG agar at 20 °C for 3 days.
Cells were stained with 1 % uranyl acetate in 0·4 % sucrose.
